thread.title: Police: Officer forced wife into closet in front of child - Atlanta Journal Constitution
thread.title_full: Police: Officer forced wife into closet in front of child - Atlanta Journal Constitution

title: Police: Officer forced wife into closet in front of child - Atlanta Journal Constitution
text:
Police: Officer forced wife into closet in front of child Police: Officer forced wife into closet in front of child Raisa Habersham Clayton County Officer Donnail Demens (Credit: Clayton County Police Department) Story Highlights Clayton County police Officer Donnail Demens was arrested Wednesday by Suwanee police. He faces child cruelty and false imprisonment charges. A rookie police officer was arrested after allegedly forcing his wife into a closet in front of their child. 
The wife of Clayton County police officer Donnail Demens also believes he burglarized her new residence shortly after she moved out of their home due to marital problems, Channel 2 Action News reported. 
Demens, who was arrested Wednesday by Suwanee police, faces false imprisonment and child cruelty charges. 
“Police officers are supposed to be enforcing laws and protecting citizens and not breaking laws and victimizing citizens, especially in this case a spouse,” Clayton County Police Chief Michael Register told the news station. 
Demens is on administrative duty pending the outcome of the case. 
“We have acted to make sure that the officer in question doesn't have contact with the public and his official powers have been removed,” Register told Channel 2. 
Demens, who has been with the department since September, is in the field training program. 
Register said the department was still gathering the facts before taking further action. 
“(He) will be treated fairly, but if he has done this he will be held accountable,” Register said. “He will not represent me.” 
In other news:
